response:

Alice is offering me $45 while taking $55. While this isn't a 50-50 split, I need to consider the inflation factors.

If I reject and we move to the next round, the money will be worth 10% less to me (so the $100 becomes worth $90 to me). Meanwhile, for Alice, it would be worth 5% less (so $95 to her).

If I make a counter-offer in the next round, Alice could reject, leading to further inflation. Given the asymmetric inflation rates, delaying generally favors Alice.

$45 now is better than potentially getting less later due to the higher inflation rate affecting me more severely.
